snippet: Hundreds of landmark buildings where wounded soldiers have received treatment, some dating back to the Civil War, are at risk of being abandoned or demolished.
abstract: Report commissioned by National Trust for Historic Preservation says hundreds of landmark buildings where wounded soldiers have received treatment, some dating back to the Civil War, are at risk of being abandoned or demolished because of poor management by officials at Department of Veterans Affairs.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of landmark buildings where wounded soldiers have received treatment, some dating back to the Civil War, are at risk of being abandoned or demolished.

headline.main: V.A. Is Faulted Over Landmarks’ Condition
headline.print_headline: V.A. Is Faulted Over Landmarks’ Condition
